definition: Hmong or Miao ethnic group of southwest China/surname Miao

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Youd better find a good teacher for him, since he is a really musical child.
sentences.chinese: 你最好给他请个好老师，他可是有音乐才能的好苗子。

sentences.english: So spare no effort to do the last match.
sentences.chinese: 为了西安这个苗子，我一定会支持到底。

sentences.english: Generally they are tidied up and any weak growth is removed.
sentences.chinese: 一般要收拾整齐，长势弱的苗子要铲除掉。

sentences.english: It is better to turn down 10 candidates in order to get one good prospect.
sentences.chinese: 宁可拒绝10名候选人而得到一个好苗子。

definition: to make sth of oneself/to become a person who is worthy of respect
to grow/to cultivate/to train/to educate/to patronize
best of its kind/cream of the crop
how well a crop (or plant) is growing/growth
top-notch (colloquial)/to push oneself to the front
Hmong or Miao ethnic group of southwest China/surname Miao
erhua variant of 拔尖[ba2 jian1]
